titleStmt.title: Six sermons preached before His Majesty at White-Hall Published by command. Tending all to give satisfaction in certain points to such who have thereupon endeavoured to unsettle the state, and government of the church. By the Right Reverend Father in God, Benjamin Laney, Late Lord Bishop of Ely.
titleStmt.author: Laney, Benjamin, 1591-1675.

titleStmt.title: Six sermons preached before His Majesty at White-Hall Published by command. Tending all to give satisfaction in certain points to such who have thereupon endeavoured to unsettle the state, and government of the church. By the Right Reverend Father in God, Benjamin Laney, Late Lord Bishop of Ely.
titleStmt.author: Laney, Benjamin, 1591-1675.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Henry Brome and Walter Kettilby, in S. Paul's Church-Yard,

notesStmt.note: Includes: "The shepherd, or The pastoral charge and obedience due to it," (1668), with separate pagination and register; "Two sermons" (1668); "The study of quiet" (1668); "Two sermons" and "The study of quiet" have continuous pagination and register; "A sermon preached before the King at White-Hall" (1675) has separate pagination and register.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
